intro: Hieracium lachnocephalum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and disturbed soils. Hieracium lachnocephalum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
